text: I’m trying to deploy a project website with github pages but somehow the final page (<https://crstnbr.github.io/JuliaConProceedingsGuide/>) seems to have the relative/absolute urls wrong. For example, when I click on “Author’s guide” it goes to <https://crstnbr.github.io/author/> rather than <https://crstnbr.github.io/JuliaConProceedingsGuide/author/>. Another obvious consequence is that css files can’t be found/loaded. I have set the `website_url` in the config.md. Any idea what I’m doing wrong? Repo is here: <https://github.com/crstnbr/JuliaConProceedingsGuide>

text: Is this a bug of the theme (“just-the-docs”)? Looking at <https://github.com/crstnbr/JuliaConProceedingsGuide/blob/main/_layout/style.html> it seems like it just assumes that one isn’t using a “subfolder” i.e. <http://my.url.com/subfolder|my.url.com/subfolder>.
